travelers.notes: Two married couples in their 50s. Neil & Kim are married; Susie & Brad are married. All experienced travelers looking for relaxed, authentic UK canal experience.

preferences.vibe: Relaxed pace, authentic UK experience. History, real ale pubs, quirky shopping, farm-to-table dining, live music.
preferences.budget: TBD - looking for comfortable but not luxury
preferences.mobility: All in good health, no restrictions
preferences.transportation: NO rental car. Train from London to narrowboat base. Narrowboat for 12 days.
mustHave: Narrowboat with 2 private double cabins (ideally 2 bathrooms for couples' comfort)
Real ale pubs along the route

routing.reasoning: Kim has Delta status and prefers to accumulate miles. ATL has direct Delta flights to London Heathrow (~9 hours). Check alternate Gulf Coast airports for significant savings.

estimatedTotal.notes: October is shoulder season, prices should be reasonable

recommendedCompanies.name: Anglo Welsh
recommendedCompanies.notes: 60 years experience, 150 boats at 9 bases. Bond 4 Class 65ft boats have 2 bedrooms + 2 bathrooms - PERFECT for two couples.
recommendedCompanies.recommendedBoat: Bond 4 Class (Gloria, Trossachs, etc.) - Premium 65ft, semi-traditional stern, 2 cabins, 2 full bathrooms, multi-fuel stove

recommendedCompanies.name: Black Prince
recommendedCompanies.notes: Quality boats, good locations. Season ends Oct 30, 2026. Multiple bases including Napton (Warwickshire).

recommendedCompanies.name: Napton Narrowboats
recommendedCompanies.notes: Family company, high-end boats. 1st Class Fleet has King-Size beds, two bathrooms. Bases at Napton and Autherley Junction.
recommendedCompanies.recommendedBoat: 1st Class Fleet with reverse layout, two full bathrooms

recommendedCompanies.name: Drifters
recommendedCompanies.notes: Consortium of 40+ bases, 500+ boats. Price match guarantee.

estimatedCost.notes: October is end of season - good availability, reasonable prices. Premium boats with 2 bathrooms at higher end.

topRecommendations.name: Oxford Canal (South)
topRecommendations.description: One of the most beautiful and popular canals. Early contour canal winding through villages. Known for hearty pubs and scenic countryside.
highlights: Pretty villages like Thrupp and Cropredy
topRecommendations.trainAccess: Oxford has direct trains from London Paddington (~1 hour)

topRecommendations.name: Warwickshire Ring
topRecommendations.description: 104 miles, 120 locks, circular route through Grand Union, Oxford, Coventry and Birmingham & Fazeley canals.
topRecommendations.historyRating: Excellent - industrial heritage meets Shakespeare country
topRecommendations.trainAccess: Leamington Spa station ~9 miles from Napton

topRecommendations.name: Kennet & Avon Canal
topRecommendations.description: Stunning canal combining countryside, market towns, and the gorgeous city of Bath.
highlights: City of Bath (Georgian architecture, Roman Baths)
topRecommendations.locks: Varies - Caen Hill flight is famous
topRecommendations.trainAccess: Bath Spa has direct trains from London Paddington (~1.5 hours)

topRecommendations.name: Cheshire Ring
topRecommendations.description: 97-mile circular through bustling towns, sleepy villages, and heart of Manchester.

routes.recommendation: Oxford Canal or Warwickshire Ring from Napton base - excellent train access via Leamington Spa, fantastic pubs, rich history, manageable locks, beautiful countryside. Perfect fit for the group's interests.

option2.route: London Euston → Rugby or Leamington Spa
option2.duration: ~1 hour to Rugby, ~1.5 hours to Leamington
option2.notes: For Napton-based trips. Would need taxi/transfer from station to marina.

option3.notes: Direct GWR trains for Kennet & Avon trips

heathrowConnections.notes: From Paddington, connect to Oxford, Bath, or cross to Euston for Rugby/Leamington

pubs.notes: Real ale pubs are a KEY priority. Will research specific canalside pubs once route is selected.
pubs.generalInfo: CAMRA (Campaign for Real Ale) Good Beer Guide is the definitive resource. Many canal pubs serve locally brewed real ales.

shopping.notes: Quirky, unique shopping is a priority. Canal towns often have antique shops, vintage stores, artisan markets.

liveMusic.notes: Traditional pub music, folk sessions. Will research specific venues once route/dates confirmed.

october.conditions: Autumn colors, possible rain, shorter days
october.clothing: Layers, waterproof jacket, warm fleece, sturdy shoes for lock work

weather.notes: October is end of narrowboat season (most companies close late October). Book early for best boat selection. Autumn foliage can be spectacular along canals.

food.notes: Mix of pub meals, onboard cooking, and special dinners
